values.description:
Screen shot of `lights.world`: https://www.dropbox.com/s/33zwdc94bvu7fyw/lights5.png

* Fixed loading point / spot / directional lights (type, target, color...)

* Added `helpers` (light visuals), the green lines representing each light type

* Lights can be selected and manipulated (light's target moves with the light)

* White default lights can be inserted from the insert menu or, for desktop, from the header

values.description:
A simple way to get shorter unique names for spawned entities.

Possible downsides:

* Only checks existing names client-side

* Reuses names of deleted entities
values.title: Generate simpler unique name for spawned entities

A simple way to get shorter unique names for spawned entities.

Possible downsides:

* Only checks existing names client-side

* Reuses names of deleted entities

values.description:
* Menu tab which displays all models and lights in the scene

* Inserted/deleted models are instantly updated

* Selecting an object on the scene highlights it on the tree and vice-versa

* Right-clicking an object on the tree opens its context menu to make it transparent/wireframe or delete it

* There's an option on the hamburger menu to open the scene tree when a model is selected or not

* New logic to select entities (`Scene.selectEntity()`) which unifies bounding box display, tree highlighting and manipulator attachment.
values.title: Scene tree

summary.raw:
* Menu tab which displays all models and lights in the scene

* Inserted/deleted models are instantly updated

* Selecting an object on the scene highlights it on the tree and vice-versa

* Right-clicking an object on the tree opens its context menu to make it transparent/wireframe or delete it

* There's an option on the hamburger menu to open the scene tree when a model is selected or not

* New logic to select entities (`Scene.selectEntity()`) which unifies bounding box display, tree highlighting and manipulator attachment.
summary.html:
• Menu tab which displays all models and lights in the scene

  • Inserted/deleted models are instantly updated

  • Selecting an object on the scene highlights it on the tree and vice-versa

  • Right-clicking an object on the tree opens its context menu to make it transparent/wireframe or delete it

  • There's an option on the hamburger menu to open the scene tree when a model is selected or not

  • New logic to select entities (Scene.selectEntity()) which unifies bounding box display, tree highlighting and manipulator attachment.

values.description:
* Property panel displays entity properties such as `name` and `pose`

* All properties are loaded to the panel when the model is loaded for the first time

* Pose updates are only sent to the panel if they're currently visible

* No properties can be edited from the panel yet

* There is no bounding box for individual links yet
values.title: Property panel for desktop and mobile (non-editable)

* There is no bounding box for individual links yet
summary.html:
• Property panel displays entity properties such as name and pose

  • All properties are loaded to the panel when the model is loaded for the first time

  • Pose updates are only sent to the panel if they're currently visible

  • No properties can be edited from the panel yet

  • There is no bounding box for individual links yet

values.description: the webify script had a problem updating the texture references in `media/models/*.dae` files as its not in a standard gazebo model directory structure. This patch adds a check for the material/texture path and skips updating dae texture references if the path doesn't exist.
values.title: Update webify script to work with gazebo media folder

summary.raw: the webify script had a problem updating the texture references in `media/models/*.dae` files as its not in a standard gazebo model directory structure. This patch adds a check for the material/texture path and skips updating dae texture references if the path doesn't exist.
summary.html: the webify script had a problem updating the texture references in media/models/*.dae files as its not in a standard gazebo model directory structure. This patch adds a check for the material/texture path and skips updating dae texture references if the path doesn't exist.

values.description:
Edit properties on property panel and see changes in real time, both on desktop and mobile.

`SCENE`: not yet

`MODELS`

* `Name`: not editable

* `Static`: not editable

* `Pose`: editable

`LINKS`

* `Name`: not editable

* `Self Collide`: editable

* `Gravity`: editable

* `Kinematic`: editable

* `Canonical`: not editable

* `Pose`: not yet

* `Inertial`: not yet

`JOINTS`: not yet

`LIGHTS`

* `Name`: not editable

* `Pose`: editable

* `Direction`: editable

* `Diffuse`: editable

* `Specular`: editable, changes not visible

* `Range`: editable

* `Attenuation`: editable, changes visible only for `Constant`

values.description:
* Added local space manipulation (mostly taken from [TransformControls.js](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/0d962f4028ef07dc8340eca269d5a2a41d0d6b5b/gz3d/client/js/include/TransformControls.js?at=default))

* Toggle between Local / World spaces by re-selecting current mode

* United functions `onMouseMove` and `onTouchMove` into `onPointerMove` and got rid of functions which existed because of the difference (`translateObject`, `rotateObjectXYZ` and `moveLightTarget`)
values.title: Manipulation in entity's local space

summary.raw:
* Added local space manipulation (mostly taken from [TransformControls.js](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/0d962f4028ef07dc8340eca269d5a2a41d0d6b5b/gz3d/client/js/include/TransformControls.js?at=default))

* Toggle between Local / World spaces by re-selecting current mode

* United functions `onMouseMove` and `onTouchMove` into `onPointerMove` and got rid of functions which existed because of the difference (`translateObject`, `rotateObjectXYZ` and `moveLightTarget`)
summary.html:
• Added local space manipulation (mostly taken from TransformControls.js)

  • Toggle between Local / World spaces by re-selecting current mode

  • United functions onMouseMove and onTouchMove into onPointerMove and got rid of functions which existed because of the difference (translateObject, rotateObjectXYZ and moveLightTarget)

values.description:

* Also organized different property levels on `gz3d.css`

* Removed panel subtitle

* Wider menus for desktop

values.description:
* Option to view joints on context menu (desktop) or radial menu (mobile).

* If model doesn't have joints, the option shows disabled on the menu.

* XYZ (red, green, blue) axes represent the joint pose w.r.t. the joint's child link.

* Yellow arrow represents the joint axis, which can be described w.r.t. the child link or to the parent model in case `use_parent_model_frame === true`. (Needs [Gazebo issue #1268](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1268/joint-visuals-are-not-properly-oriented) fixed to receive flag on joint message. Now `true` by default as most old models have it true.)

* Different joint visuals according to joint type (`revolute`, `revolute2`, `prismatic`, `universal`, `ball`, `screw`, `gearbox`).

![joints7.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5RMr4M/images/3224281410-joints7.png)
values.title: View joints

summary.raw:
* Option to view joints on context menu (desktop) or radial menu (mobile).

* If model doesn't have joints, the option shows disabled on the menu.

* XYZ (red, green, blue) axes represent the joint pose w.r.t. the joint's child link.

* Yellow arrow represents the joint axis, which can be described w.r.t. the child link or to the parent model in case `use_parent_model_frame === true`. (Needs [Gazebo issue #1268](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1268/joint-visuals-are-not-properly-oriented) fixed to receive flag on joint message. Now `true` by default as most old models have it true.)

* Different joint visuals according to joint type (`revolute`, `revolute2`, `prismatic`, `universal`, `ball`, `screw`, `gearbox`).

![joints7.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5RMr4M/images/3224281410-joints7.png)
summary.html:
• Option to view joints on context menu (desktop) or radial menu (mobile).

  • If model doesn't have joints, the option shows disabled on the menu.

  • XYZ (red, green, blue) axes represent the joint pose w.r.t. the joint's child link.

  • Yellow arrow represents the joint axis, which can be described w.r.t. the child link or to the parent model in case use_parent_model_frame === true. (Needs Gazebo issue #1268 fixed to receive flag on joint message. Now true by default as most old models have it true.)

  • Different joint visuals according to joint type (revolute, revolute2, prismatic, universal, ball, screw, gearbox).

values.description:
* Option to view / hide orbit indicator (yellow dot): `View -> Orbit Indicator`, `true` by default

* Pressing `del` key deletes selected object

* Context menu closes when clicking on the GUI (also clock pop-up for touch)

* "XX inserted", "XX deleted" notifications now only come after insertion / deletion on server

* Display property units on property panel (m, Kg, etc)
values.title: Hide orbit indicator / Del key to delete entities

summary.raw:
* Option to view / hide orbit indicator (yellow dot): `View -> Orbit Indicator`, `true` by default

* Pressing `del` key deletes selected object

* Context menu closes when clicking on the GUI (also clock pop-up for touch)

* "XX inserted", "XX deleted" notifications now only come after insertion / deletion on server

* Display property units on property panel (m, Kg, etc)
summary.html:
• Option to view / hide orbit indicator (yellow dot): View -> Orbit Indicator, true by default

  • Pressing del key deletes selected object

  • Context menu closes when clicking on the GUI (also clock pop-up for touch)

  • "XX inserted", "XX deleted" notifications now only come after insertion / deletion on server

  • Display property units on property panel (m, Kg, etc)

values.description:
* There were 3 README files in different directories, I'm merging them into one.

* Also added a script which I've been using to simplify the process of editing the javascript source code.

* Made some fixes to the documentation so jsdoc runs without complaining. Documentation can be generated by `./updateGZ3D.sh -d`. ~~I don't understand why it isn't being automatically generated from [this](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/d7e61713542bcb8d997710959cea438904341937/gz3d/utils/Gruntfile.js?at=update_docs#cl-82) line.~~
values.title: Merge all READMEs and add update script

summary.raw:
* There were 3 README files in different directories, I'm merging them into one.

* Also added a script which I've been using to simplify the process of editing the javascript source code.

* Made some fixes to the documentation so jsdoc runs without complaining. Documentation can be generated by `./updateGZ3D.sh -d`. ~~I don't understand why it isn't being automatically generated from [this](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/d7e61713542bcb8d997710959cea438904341937/gz3d/utils/Gruntfile.js?at=update_docs#cl-82) line.~~
summary.html:
• There were 3 README files in different directories, I'm merging them into one.

  • Also added a script which I've been using to simplify the process of editing the javascript source code.

  • Made some fixes to the documentation so jsdoc runs without complaining. Documentation can be generated by ./updateGZ3D.sh -d. I don't understand why it isn't being automatically generated from this line.

values.description:
* created branch gzweb_1.2.0

* switch to use find_package to find gazebo

* Close branch gzweb_find_gazebo

* Created new branch three.js_r71

* update three.js to r71


Dear gzweb Team,

I'm working for the HBP (Human Brain Project) and we're making great use of gzweb. We also want to expand and improve on it.
As a first step to prepare for future features I updated the revision of THREE.js to r71. These are the changes I made. Please see if you're interested in merging them in and if anything stopped working (hope I didn't miss anything). :)

Best regards,
Sandro Weber
values.title: Three.js_r71

values.description:
The topic for handling lights has been split into two on [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1920/physics-light-and-physics-lightstate/diff) Gazbeo pull request. All these should work now:

* light modifications from client are reflected on server

* light spaws from client are reflected on server

Open gzclient and gzweb at the same time:

* light changes made on gzclient reflected on gzweb

* light spawned from gzclient show on gzweb
values.title: Make lights work with Gazebo7's new topics

summary.raw:
The topic for handling lights has been split into two on [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1920/physics-light-and-physics-lightstate/diff) Gazbeo pull request. All these should work now:

* light modifications from client are reflected on server

* light spaws from client are reflected on server

Open gzclient and gzweb at the same time:

* light changes made on gzclient reflected on gzweb

* light spawned from gzclient show on gzweb
summary.html:
The topic for handling lights has been split into two on this Gazbeo pull request. All these should work now:

  • light modifications from client are reflected on server

  • light spaws from client are reflected on server

Open gzclient and gzweb at the same time:

  • light changes made on gzclient reflected on gzweb

  • light spawned from gzclient show on gzweb

values.description:
* change wireframe from dublicate geometry to THREE.Material.wireframe

* cosmetic fix


Hi there :)

Recently discovered an issue with the wireframe display of objects. We have a room with models inside. Setting the room to be displayed as wireframe would cause the dublicate geometry created for wireframe mode to block any further object selection raycasts. Essentially nothing inside the room could be selected anymore.
This pull request removes the generation of wireframe-specific geometry and instead uses the THREE.Material.wireframe option (try it out here http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Materials/MeshBasicMaterial). Saves some memory too :D.

Best regards,
Sandro Weber
values.title: Wireframe_by_material

summary.raw:
* change wireframe from dublicate geometry to THREE.Material.wireframe

* cosmetic fix


Hi there :)

Recently discovered an issue with the wireframe display of objects. We have a room with models inside. Setting the room to be displayed as wireframe would cause the dublicate geometry created for wireframe mode to block any further object selection raycasts. Essentially nothing inside the room could be selected anymore.
This pull request removes the generation of wireframe-specific geometry and instead uses the THREE.Material.wireframe option (try it out here http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Materials/MeshBasicMaterial). Saves some memory too :D.

Best regards,
Sandro Weber
summary.html:
• change wireframe from dublicate geometry to THREE.Material.wireframe

  • cosmetic fix

Hi there :)

Recently discovered an issue with the wireframe display of objects. We have a room with models inside. Setting the room to be displayed as wireframe would cause the dublicate geometry created for wireframe mode to block any further object selection raycasts. Essentially nothing inside the room could be selected anymore. This pull request removes the generation of wireframe-specific geometry and instead uses the THREE.Material.wireframe option (try it out here http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Materials/MeshBasicMaterial). Saves some memory too :D.

Best regards, Sandro Weber

values.description:
Not all of them are being properly loaded though. We can remove them or create issues.

values.description:
the `IsConnected` check was added to prevent processing messages if no clients are connected. 

The road message is a little different. It's only received once when the bridge is first launched so we need to keep a copy of the message for all client connections
values.title: Fix rendering roads

summary.raw:
the `IsConnected` check was added to prevent processing messages if no clients are connected. 

The road message is a little different. It's only received once when the bridge is first launched so we need to keep a copy of the message for all client connections

values.description:
* Added optional 'port' argument

* Updated README for start_gzweb port arg

I've already got a thing running on port 8080 which can't be changed.  Rather than just editing the file locally, I figured it would be good to provide this arg for other users.

(If no arg is provided, port 8080 is used by default.)
values.title: Add port number arg

summary.raw:
* Added optional 'port' argument

* Updated README for start_gzweb port arg

I've already got a thing running on port 8080 which can't be changed.  Rather than just editing the file locally, I figured it would be good to provide this arg for other users.

(If no arg is provided, port 8080 is used by default.)
summary.html:
• Added optional 'port' argument

I've already got a thing running on port 8080 which can't be changed. Rather than just editing the file locally, I figured it would be good to provide this arg for other users.

(If no arg is provided, port 8080 is used by default.)

values.description: Currently inserting a complex model with large number of links, e.g. pr2, kills the framerate. Throttling the tree updates fixes the problem.
values.title: Throttle gui model pose update

summary.raw: Currently inserting a complex model with large number of links, e.g. pr2, kills the framerate. Throttling the tree updates fixes the problem.
summary.html: Currently inserting a complex model with large number of links, e.g. pr2, kills the framerate. Throttling the tree updates fixes the problem.

values.description:
The mouse cursor should now stay with the target object as the camera pans

- Fixed camera to object distance.

- Fix use of incorrect fov. The previous calculation assumed `scope.object.fov` is horizontal but it's actually vertical.
values.title: Fix mouse panning

summary.raw:
The mouse cursor should now stay with the target object as the camera pans

- Fixed camera to object distance.

- Fix use of incorrect fov. The previous calculation assumed `scope.object.fov` is horizontal but it's actually vertical.
summary.html:
The mouse cursor should now stay with the target object as the camera pans

  • Fixed camera to object distance.

  • Fix use of incorrect fov. The previous calculation assumed scope.object.fov is horizontal but it's actually vertical.
